results.title: Schindler's list
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Branko Lustig, Gerald Molen, Amblin Entertainment and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: Staggering adaptation of Thomas Keneally’s novel of the same name about an Austrian businessman who, during the Second World War, saved 1,100 Polish Jews from Nazi slaughter by using them in his factory manufacturing crockery for the German Army. Filmed almost entirely on location in Poland in gritty monochrome, this is a brilliantly realised, fiercely controlled and restrained treatment of a true story. Harsh and compassionate, it avoids sentimentality until the end. The three central performances, Liam Neeson who is towering as Oskar Schindler, Ben Kingsley as his Jewish accountant and Ralph Fiennes as the odious Nazi Commandant Amon Goeth, are unforgettable. Winner of seven Academy Awards for: Best Picture of the Year, Best Achievement in Directing, Best Screenplay based on Material Previously Produced or Published, Best Achievement in Cinematography, Best Achievement in Film Editing, Best Achievement in Music, and Best Production Design.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Branko Lustig, Gerald Molen, Amblin Entertainment and Universal City Studios Productions

results.title: Running water
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Antelope Films, Channel Four and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
Managing the rivers will be an important part of managing global climate changes. Using satellite technologies, this program visits the great river basins of the planet - the Nile, Amazon, Mississippi, Ganges, Danube and the Yellow River. These mighty watercourses have a profound influence on the people who conduct their daily life along their banks.

results.title: The New global geography
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Antelope Films, Channel Four and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
In conjunction with modern computing power, space technology is helping scientists to create global geography. The aim is to discover how Spaceship Earth’s life-support system really works, and how natural and human forces are changing it. Satellites help us to understand our planet, particularly in monitoring global weather patterns which can shift rapidly.

results.title: Paris Trout
results.creator_credit: Stephen Gyllenhaal, Frank Konigsberg, Larry Sanitsky and Viacom Pictures
results.brief_description: In what has been hailed as his best performance, Academy Award nominee, Dennis Hopper stars as Paris Trout, a man riddled with hatred and obsessed with inflicting cruelty on those who dare to cross him. With a magnificent supporting cast including Barbara Hershey and Ed Harris, Paris Trout was applauded by critics worldwide as a must-see, chilling, erotic thriller. “In this spectacular character study of a man whose soul is rotting with pure evil, Hopper gives a performance of such magnitude that it’s painful to watch and impossible to look away.” - Michael Dare, Billboard Magazine. Based on the novel by Pete Dexter. Co-starring Tina Lifford, Darnita Henry, Eric Ware, Ronreaco Lee and Ray McKinnon.

results.title: La Ronde = Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Roger Vadim, Raymond Hakim and Robert Hakim
results.brief_description: La Ronde is a romantic drama with an all-star cast lead by Jane Fonda, Jean Sorel and Catherine Spaak. It is set in pre-World War I Paris when the city was caught in a fever pitch of gaiety and affairs of the heart. Based on Arthur Schintzler’s famous stage play “Reigen”, the screenplay is given a fresh viewpoint by applying French psychology to the pursuit of love in its various forms. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Death warmed up
results.creator_credit: David Blyth, Murray Newey and Tucker Production Company
results.brief_description: Michael Tucker (Michael Hurst) is programmed to kill his parents by genetic surgeon, Dr Archer Howell (Gary Day) and is incarcerated in a psychiatric institution for the crime. Years later, Michael and friends travel to an isolated Island where Howell now runs Transcranial Applications, experimenting on humans and turning them into mutant killing machines. Michael seeks revenge on Howell for the death of his parents but also to stop him for the sake of mankind. Co-starring Margaret Umbers, William Upjohn, Norelle Scott, Bruno Lawrence and David Letch.

results.title: The Late show
results.creator_credit: Robert Benton, Robert Altman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Ira Wells (Art Carney) is an ageing private eye trying to solve the murder of his ex-partner (Howard Duff), “helped” by Margo (Lily Tomlin), a flaky, aimless young woman. The chemistry between Carney and Tomlin is perfect and echoes of Chandler and Hammett resound in Benton’s complex but likeable script. This quietly authoritative show-stopper is a marvellous comment on classics like “The Maltese Falcon” and “The Big Sleep”, while at the same time taking its place beside them as a superior example of the genre. Also starring Bill Macy and Eugene Roche. Co-starring Joanna Cassidy, John Considine, Ruth Nelson, Howard Duff and John Davey.

results.title: Goodbye paradise (AFC)
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Jane Scott, New South Wales Film Corporation and Petersham Films
results.brief_description: Cited by Scott Murray as “one of the most underrated films of the post-1970s revival” ‘Goodbye Paradise’ freely references film-noir conventions including the voice-over and the hero as world-weary outsider. Set in a hyper-corrupt Queensland on the verge of a right-wing coup, the films follows a boozy investigative journalist (Ray Barrett) who stumbles upon the coup plot while searching for a senator’s wayward daughter. Murray describes the film as a ‘very clever piece of controlled fabulation which bursts out of genre strictures into liberating anarchy. Having the absolute courage of its convictions, it takes ideas and boldly pushes them beyond the safe and into a poetic and powerful hyper-realism’. Reference: ‘Australian Film 1978-1994’ Oxford University Press, Melbourne, 1995, p. 128. Winner of AFI 1982 Best Actor - Ray Barrett, Best Screenplay. Cast also includes Robyn Nevin, Guy Doleman, Lex Marinos, Paul Chubb and Kate Fitzpatrick.

results.title: Came a hot friday
results.creator_credit: Ian Mune, Larry Parr, Challenge Film Corporation and Mirage Films
results.brief_description: It is 1949. The privations of war are over and there is money to be made! Two conmen have been successfully cheating bookies at racetracks across the United States. When they stop at a small town called Tainuia Junction, their luck runs out. After waging a war with the local police and the owner of the town casino, they enlist the aid of the Tainuia Kid, a Zorro nut and the wildest comic ever to ride the ranges. It is the bad guys versus the not-so-bad guys in this off-the-wall comedy that takes the viewer on a rollercoaster of laughs against a backdrop of horseracing, gambling, fast cars and loose women. Starring Billy T. James, Peter Bland, Phillip Gordon and Marshall Napier. Based on the novel by Ronald Hugh Morrieson.

results.title: Hellfire Jack
results.creator_credit: John Boland, BTV6 and John Boland and Associates
results.brief_description: A graphic, compelling and factual account of the life of John Curtin, tracing his life from his birth in 1885, through his hellfire youth, his chequered political career and drinking problems, to the highest position in the nation. Painstakingly researched, this program features contributions from leading academics and politicians. It does not present a glamourised version of Curtin’s life, but looks objectively at the man and his actions. Curtin was a man of great strength and yet his battle with drinking threatened to ruin his personal and public life. He witnessed and took part in some of the momentous events in Australian history such as the Conscription debate in World War I, and occupied the political stage with such figures as Robert Menzies and Archbishop Mannix. Narrated by Leo McKern.
